column4: hi folks, I just installet latest Ubuntu 5.10 and now upon boot the X server start but the screen goes dark - help I am lost
please switch to a console and inspect /var/log/Xorg.0.log
did that too - it detects the card correctly -> radeon mobility 9600 pro
I've got the feeling that it does akward things with the DST - is this the default now?
not sure what happened then...you're using fglrx?
it is the first start after the install
have you tried sudo dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg to verify it's setup correctly?
no, good idea thanks - i will do it now
you might also consider trying to install the fglrx drivers, if you want to
yes I will try the ati bins but it's a shame that ubuntu chokes on an dell inspiron 8600...
that's not normal.  You're sure the cd burn was successful?  Did the install seem to go smoothly?
well burned the iso with a mac (mac os x) and took the n00b install mode. the old ubuntu worked well
can you check the md5sum of the .iso?
good idea again - i will check
hm, md5sums differ :/  my file is also called "ubuntu-5.10-install-i386.iso" and the downloadable ones are called "ubuntu-5.10-rc-install-i386.iso" - damn I took the bittorrent download
you have the right image, but sounds like it's corrupted
